item.title: The rising relevance of Cloud Native Programming
item.description: I got to learn about Cloud Native Computing Foundation as I was browsing through Helm. From CNCF website: The Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) hosts critical components of the global technology infrastructure. CNCF brings together the world’s top developers, end users, and vendors and runs the largest open source developer conferences. CNCF is part of the nonprofit Linux Foundation. It is also important to understand the meaning of cloud native computing and what the approach covers / recommends.

item.title: Knowledge base: Graph systems
item.description: Graph Systems Documenting a list of graph systems. Alibaba Graph Database - A real-time, reliable, cloud-native graph database service that supports property graph model. Amazon Neptune - Fully-managed graph database service. ArangoDB - OLTP Provider for ArangoDB. Bitsy - A small, fast, embeddable, durable in-memory graph database. Blazegraph - RDF graph database with OLTP support. CosmosDB - Microsoft’s distributed OLTP graph database. ChronoGraph - A versioned graph database. DSEGraph - DataStax graph database with OLTP and OLAP support.

item.title: Learnings 1: For the love of tennis
item.description: I am at my fourth day of formal tennis learning on June 8, 2020. While the first day gives you a lot of confidence as you start hitting the ball, it is not soon that you realize in the 3rd or 4th day the importance of technique in the game. Below are the 4 key learnings that I got for a beginner level tennis player: Stance: The key element to understand both fore-hand and back-hand hitting in tennis is the stance or the body position wrt to the ball.

item.title: Spark on Yarn Configurations
item.description: Spark on YARN - Considerations and Configurations About Spark Apache Spark™ is a DAG based execution engine for large-scale data processing. It has in-memory processing capabilities making it faster as compared to other execution engines. Spark boasts ease of use and generality through native language support (R, Scala, Python, Java ) and SQL & streaming analytics respectively. Spark on Yarn Spark runs on Hadoop (YARN), Mesos, standalone, or in the cloud.

item.title: Machine Learning - Spark Over Mahout
item.description: Machine Learning - Spark Over Mahout I started my career writing code in Java. I definitely love the object oriented language and the GC support. I experienced the native side of Java while implementing few low latency high throughput applications at a financial institution. The power is immense. As I started developing machine learning models in Hadoop, Apache Mahout was my straight forward choice since it was natively implemented in Java.

item.title: Time to market for Big Data Analytics
item.description: Data, Model, Score, Decision - Time-to-market for Big Data Analytics One of the known challenges for Big data analytics has been the time-to-market OR production deployment of analytical models and solutions. What does that mean: Organizations have multiple problems to solve which impact their bottom and top-line. Various analytical solutions (descriptive and predictive) are developed to optimize their operations. Once these solutions are ready to predict the best possible business outcomes, the next step is to operationalize them in a production environment.

item.title: Big Data 2016 Challenges
item.description: Big Data 2.016 - Practical implementation challenges We have all witnessed the journey of “Big data” from inception until 2015. Big data got a fair share of attention and has passed through the hype cycle. In 2016, there is a different set of challenges that organizations need to overcome for realizing the true potential of Big data through analytics. These challenges are primarily related to implementation of Big Data projects.
